00026 /*
00027  * Just dump the vector out
00028  *
00029  * @param v - some vector we want to see dumped out
00030  */
00031 void td(const std::vector<double> &v)
00032 {
00033         cout.precision(12);
00034   cout.setf(ios_base::showpoint|ios_base::fixed|ios_base::showpos);
00035   //
00036         for(unsigned int i=0; i<v.size(); i++) {
00037                 cout << v[i] << "\t";
00038   }
00039         cout << endl;
00040 }
00041 
00042 /*
00043  * comma delimited dump
00044  *
00045  * @param v - vector to be dumped
00046  * @param out - stream to dump it to
00047  */
00048 void ctd(const std::vector<double> &v,std::ostream &out)
00049 {
00050         for(unsigned int i=0; i<v.size(); i++)
00051                 out << v[i] << ",";
00052         out<< "\t";
00053 }

00058 /*
00059  * mean of a vector
00060  *
00061  * @param v - vector to be averaged
00062  */
00063 double compute_mean(const std::vector<double> &v) {
00064         double sum;
00065         sum =0;
00066         for (unsigned int i=0; i<v.size(); i++)
00067                 sum += v[i];
00068         sum /= v.size();
00069         return(sum);
00070 }
00071 
00072 /*
00073  * normal likelihood density without constants
00074  *
00075  * @param x - observed value
00076  * @param m - mean
00077  * @param s - standard deviation
00078  */
00079 double dnorm(const double x,const double m,const double s)
00080 {
00081         // don't care about constants
00082         return( exp(-(x-m)*(x-m)/(2*s*s))/s);
00083 }
00084 
00085 /*
00086  * multiply element-wise two vectors and sum
00087  *
00088  * @param a - first vector
00089  * @param b - second vector
00090  */
00091 double vprod(const std::vector<double> &a,const std::vector<double> &b)
00092 {
00093         double tmp=0.0;
00094         for (unsigned int i=0; i<a.size(); i++)
00095         {
00096                 tmp += a[i]*b[i];
00097         }
00098         return(tmp);
00099 }
00100 
00101 /*
00102  * Fill vector with value x
00103  *
00104  * @param v - my vector
00105  * @param x - the value
00106  */
00107 void FillVector(std::vector<double> &v,const double x)
00108 {
00109         for (unsigned int i=0; i<v.size(); i++)
00110                 v[i] = x;
00111 }
00112 
00113 /*
00114  * compute weights of data points for a genotype
00115  *
00116  * @param w - output weights
00117  * @param m - vector of estimated means for each snp for this genotype
00118  * @param sigma - within-snp variance
00119  * @param Contrast - actual observed values for each snp
00120  */
00121 void Compute_Weights(std::vector<double> &w,
00122                      const std::vector<double> &m,
00123                      const double sigma,
00124                      const std::vector<double> &Contrast)
00125 {
00126         // compute dnorm for everything
00127         for (unsigned int i=0; i<Contrast.size(); i++)
00128         {
00129                 w[i] = dnorm(Contrast[i],m[i],sigma);
00130         }
00131 }
00132 
00133 /*
00134  *  Likelihood of the snp
00135  *
00136  * @param lik_per_snp - vector of likelihoods, one per snp
00137  * @param wAA - weight of AA genotype  model
00138  * @param wAB - weight of AB genotype model
00139  * @param wBB - weight of BB genotype model
00140  * @param p   - probability of a genotype overall
00141  */
00142 void LikelihoodPerSNP(std::vector<double> &lik_per_snp,
00143                       const std::vector<double> &wAA,
00144                       const std::vector<double> &wAB,
00145                       const std::vector<double> &wBB,
00146                       const std::vector<double> &p)
00147 {
00148         for (unsigned int i=0; i<wAA.size(); i++)
00149         {
00150                 lik_per_snp[i] = p[2]*wAA[i]+p[1]*wAB[i]+p[0]*wBB[i];
00151         }
00152 }
00153 
00154 /*
00155  * Odds of this genotype per snp
00156  *
00157  * @param geno - relative prob of genotype
00158  * @param w - weight of snp
00159  * @param d - overall sum
00160  * @param p - probability of this genotype
00161  */
00162 void GenotypePerSNP(std::vector<double> &geno,
00163                     const std::vector<double> &w,
00164                     const std::vector<double> &d,
00165                     const double p)
00166 {
00167         for (unsigned int i=0; i<w.size(); i++)
00168                 geno[i] = p*w[i]/d[i];
00169 }
00170 
00171 /*
00172  * computes the log-likelihood of the whole model
00173  *
00174  * @param lik_per_snp - likeihood per snp to be added up on log scale
00175  */
00176 double ComputeLL(const std::vector<double> &lik_per_snp)
00177 {
00178         double sum=0;
00179         for (unsigned int i=0; i<lik_per_snp.size(); i++)
00180                 sum += log(lik_per_snp[i]);
00181         return(sum);
00182 }
00183 
00184 /*
00185  * Computes the within-genotype variation
00186  *
00187  * @param c - contrast value per snp
00188  * @param m - expected mean per snp
00189  * @param z - weight of this snp for computing sigma
00190  */
00191 double WeightedSigma(const std::vector<double> &c,
00192                      const std::vector<double> &m,
00193                      const std::vector<double> &z)
00194 {
00195         double sum,denom;
00196         sum=denom=0;
00197         for (unsigned int i=0; i<m.size(); i++)
00198         {
00199                 sum += (c[i]-m[i])*(c[i]-m[i])*z[i];
00200                 denom += z[i];
00201         }
00202         return(sqrt(sum/denom));
00203 }
00204 
00205 /*
00206  * In case variation too small, set a floor
00207  *
00208  * @param s - sigma values
00209  * @param m - minimal value
00210  */
00211 void MinSigma(std::vector<double> &s,const double m)
00212 {
00213         for (unsigned int i=0; i<s.size(); i++)
00214                 if (s[i]<m)
00215                         s[i] = m;
00216 }
00217 
00218 /*
00219  * Initialize the variables driving EM fit
00220  *
00221  * @param mu - mean for each genotype
00222  * @param sigma - variance within each genotype
00223  * @param probs - probabilities of each genotype
00224  * @pram Contrast - contrast for each snp
00225  */
00226 void InitializeEMVars(std::vector<double> &mu,
00227                       std::vector<double> &sigma,
00228                       std::vector<double> &probs,
00229                       const std::vector<double> Contrast)
00230 {
00231         vector<double> quantiles;
00232   // @todo fix this
00233         quantiles.resize(Contrast.size());
00234         for (unsigned int i=0; i<Contrast.size(); i++)
00235                 quantiles[i] = Contrast[i];
00236         sort(quantiles.begin(),quantiles.end(),less<double>());
00237   //
00238         int qlevel;
00239         qlevel = quantiles.size()/6;
00240         mu.push_back(quantiles[qlevel]);
00241         mu.push_back(0);
00242         mu.push_back(quantiles[quantiles.size()-qlevel]);
00243         double tmpsigma;
00244         tmpsigma = mu[0]-quantiles[qlevel/2];
00245         tmpsigma += quantiles[quantiles.size()-qlevel/2]-mu[2];
00246         tmpsigma /=2;
00247         sigma.push_back(tmpsigma);
00248         sigma.push_back(tmpsigma/2);
00249         sigma.push_back(tmpsigma);
00250         probs.push_back(1/3.0);
00251         probs.push_back(1/3.0);
00252         probs.push_back(1/3.0);
00253 }
00254 
00255 /*
00256  * Does a "null" fit to the data, all estimates same for all snps
00257  *
00258  * @param Contrast - contrast values for each snp
00259  * @param Strength - strength values for each snp
00260  * @param zG - weight for each snp
00261  * @param Predictor - predictor function for this snp
00262  * @param Fitted - fitted values
00263  */
00264 void Dummy_Fit(const std::vector<double> &Contrast,
00265                const std::vector<double> &Strength,
00266                const std::vector<double> &zG,
00267                std::vector<double> &Predictor,
00268                std::vector<double> &Fitted)
00269 {
00270         // fit Contrast to covariates with weights zG
00271         // returning predicted values mG
00272         // currently uses no covariates at all and just takes means
00273         double sum, denom,tmp;
00274         sum=denom=0;
00275 
00276         for (unsigned int i=0; i<Contrast.size(); i++)
00277         {
00278                 sum += Contrast[i]*zG[i];
00279                 denom += zG[i];
00280         }
00281         tmp = sum/denom;
00282         Predictor.resize(4);
00283         Predictor[0]=tmp;
00284         Predictor[1]=Predictor[2]=Predictor[3]=0;
00285         FillVector(Fitted,tmp);
00286 }
00287 
00288 /*
00289  * Fits a weighted cubic regression on predictor(s)
00290  *
00291  * @param contrast - want to predict this value per snp
00292  * @param strength - covariate of choice
00293  * @param weights - weight of data points for this genotype
00294  * @param Predictor - output, prediction function coefficients
00295  * @param Predicted - output, predicted contrast per snp
00296  */
00297 void
00298 FitWeightedCubic(const std::vector<double> &contrast,
00299                  const std::vector<double> &strength,
00300                  const std::vector<double> &weights,
00301                  std::vector<double> &Predictor,
00302                  std::vector<double> &Predicted) {
00303 
00304         // Singular value decomposition method
00305         unsigned int i;
00306         unsigned int nobs;
00307         unsigned int npred;
00308         npred = 3+1;
00309         nobs= contrast.size();
00310 
00311         // convert double into doubles to match newmat
00312   vector<Real> tmp_vec(nobs);
00313   Real* tmp_ptr = &tmp_vec[0];
00314         vector<Real> obs_vec(nobs);
00315         Real *obs_ptr = &obs_vec[0];
00316         vector<Real> weight_vec(nobs);
00317 
00318   Matrix covarMat(nobs,npred);
00319         ColumnVector observedVec(nobs);
00320 
00321         // fill in the data
00322         // modified by weights
00323         for (i=0; i<nobs; i++)
00324                 weight_vec[i] = sqrt(weights[i]);
00325 
00326         // load data - 1s into col 1 of matrix
00327         for (i=0; i<nobs; i++)
00328                 tmp_vec[i] = weight_vec[i];
00329         covarMat.Column(1) << tmp_ptr;
00330         for (i=0; i<nobs; i++)
00331                 tmp_vec[i] *= strength[i];
00332         covarMat.Column(2) << tmp_ptr;
00333         for (i=0; i<nobs; i++)
00334                 tmp_vec[i] *= strength[i];
00335         covarMat.Column(3) << tmp_ptr;
00336         for (i=0; i<nobs; i++)
00337                 tmp_vec[i] *= strength[i];
00338         covarMat.Column(4) << tmp_ptr;
00339 
00340         for (i=0; i<nobs; i++)
00341                 obs_vec[i] = contrast[i]*weight_vec[i];
00342         observedVec << obs_ptr;
00343 
00344         // do SVD
00345         Matrix U, V;
00346         DiagonalMatrix D;
00347     ColumnVector Fitted(nobs);
00348     ColumnVector A(npred);
00349 
00350         SVD(covarMat,D,U,V);
00351 
00352         Fitted = U.t() * observedVec;
00353         A = V * ( D.i() * Fitted );
00354 
00355         // this predicts "0" for low weights
00356         // because of weighted regression
00357         Fitted = U * Fitted;
00358 
00359         // this is the predictor
00360         Predictor.resize(npred);
00361         for (i=0; i<npred; i++)
00362                 Predictor[i] = A.element(i);
00363 
00364 
00365   // export data back to doubles
00366         // and therefore this predicts "0" for low-weighted points
00367         // which is >not< the desired outcome!!!!
00368         // instead we need to predict all points at once
00369         // >unweighted< as output
00370         vector<double> Goofy;
00371         Predicted.resize(nobs);
00372         for (i = 0; i < nobs; ++i) {
00373       Goofy.resize(npred);
00374       Goofy[0] = 1;
00375       Goofy[1] = strength[i];
00376       Goofy[2] = strength[i]*Goofy[1];
00377       Goofy[3] = strength[i]*Goofy[2];
00378       Predicted[i] = vprod(Goofy,Predictor);
00379         }
00380 }
00381 
00382 /*
00383  * Sets a hard shell so that genotypes can't cross the center
00384  *
00385  * @param Contrast - observed contrast value
00386  * @param wAA - weight for the case of this point being AA
00387  * @param wBB - weight for the case of this point being BB
00388  */
00389 void HardShell(const std::vector<double> &Contrast,
00390                std::vector<double> &wAA,
00391                std::vector<double> &wBB)
00392 {
00393         for (unsigned int i=0; i<Contrast.size(); i++) {
00394     if (Contrast[i]<0)
00395       wAA[i] = 0;
00396     else
00397       wBB[i] = 0;
00398   }
00399 }
00400 
00401 /*
00402  *  Do EM repeatedly to fit normalization functions for each genotype
00403  *
00404  * @param Contrast - contrast values for each snp
00405  * @param Strength - strength values for each snp
00406  * @param max_iterations - don't go to infinity
00407  * @param log_lik_convergence - stopped making progress
00408  * @param NP - output prediction functions for each genotype
00409  */
00410 void EMContrast(const std::vector<double> &Contrast,
00411                 const std::vector<double> &Strength,
00412                 const int max_iterations,
00413                 const double log_lik_convergence,
00414                 NormalizationPredictor &NP)
00415 {
00416         // this is the only routine that needs newmat
00417         // so I can isolate it!
00418         vector<double> mu;
00419         vector<double> sigma;
00420         vector<double> probs;
00421         vector<double> wAA,wAB,wBB;
00422         vector<double> mAA,mAB,mBB;
00423         vector<double> zAA,zAB,zBB;
00424         vector<double> lik_per_snp;
00425 
00426         double last_log_lik,log_lik_diff,curr_log_lik;
00427         unsigned int n_iterations,nSNP;
00428 
00429         InitializeEMVars(mu,sigma,probs,Contrast);
00430         NP.TargetCenter.resize(3);
00431         NP.TargetCenter[0]=-.66;
00432         NP.TargetCenter[1]=0;
00433         NP.TargetCenter[2]= .66;
00434         NP.CenterCovariates.resize(3);
00435         NP.CenterCovariates[0] = 0;
00436         NP.CenterCovariates[1] = 0;
00437         NP.CenterCovariates[2] = 0;
00438 
00439         nSNP = Contrast.size();
00440         mAA.resize(nSNP);
00441         mAB.resize(nSNP);
00442         mBB.resize(nSNP);
00443         wAA.resize(nSNP);
00444         wAB.resize(nSNP);
00445         wBB.resize(nSNP);
00446         zAA.resize(nSNP);
00447         zAB.resize(nSNP);
00448         zBB.resize(nSNP);
00449         lik_per_snp.resize(nSNP);
00450 
00451         FillVector(mBB,mu[0]);
00452         FillVector(mAB,mu[1]);
00453         FillVector(mAA,mu[2]);
00454         Compute_Weights(wAA,mAA,sigma[2],Contrast);
00455         Compute_Weights(wAB,mAB,sigma[1],Contrast);
00456         Compute_Weights(wBB,mBB,sigma[0],Contrast);
00457 
00458         last_log_lik = -1000000;
00459         log_lik_diff = log_lik_convergence+1;
00460         n_iterations = 0;
00461 
00462         while (log_lik_diff > log_lik_convergence && n_iterations < max_iterations){
00463                 n_iterations += 1;
00464                 // E step
00465                 // update probs for each group
00466                 // relative genotype probability per SNP
00467                 // relative likelihood steps
00468                 LikelihoodPerSNP(lik_per_snp,wAA,wAB,wBB,probs);
00469                 //cout<< "likpersnp\t";
00470                 //td(lik_per_snp);
00471                 GenotypePerSNP(zAA,wAA,lik_per_snp,probs[2]);
00472                 GenotypePerSNP(zAB,wAB,lik_per_snp,probs[1]);
00473                 GenotypePerSNP(zBB,wBB,lik_per_snp,probs[0]);
00474                 /*td(zAA);
00475                 td(zAB);
00476                 td(zBB);*/
00477                 probs[0] = compute_mean(zBB);
00478                 probs[1] = compute_mean(zAB);
00479                 probs[2] = compute_mean(zAA);
00480                 //cout << "probs:\t";
00481                 //td(probs);
00482                 curr_log_lik = ComputeLL(lik_per_snp);
00483                 //cout << "curr_lik:\t" << curr_log_lik << endl;
00484                 log_lik_diff = curr_log_lik-last_log_lik;
00485                 last_log_lik = curr_log_lik;
00486                 // done with E step
00487 
00488                 // now do the big M step
00489                 // do magic: generate predictors for each group
00490                 // how to do magic:  SVD of of design matrix outside of loop
00491                 // do magic within loop
00492                 // fitAA = predictor weighted by zAA
00493                 // mAA = current predictions for this
00494                 // fitAB = predictor weighted by zAB
00495                 // mAB = current predictions for this
00496                 // fitBB = predictor weighted by zBB
00497                 // mBB = current predictions for this genotype by snp
00498                 //Dummy_Fit(Contrast,mAA,zAA);
00499                 Dummy_Fit(Contrast,Strength,zAB,NP.fitAB,mAB);
00500                 //Dummy_Fit(Contrast,mBB,zBB);
00501                 // try the real one
00502                 FitWeightedCubic(Contrast,Strength,zAA,NP.fitAA,mAA);
00503                 //FitWeightedCubic(Contrast,Strength,zAB,NP.fitAB,mAB);
00504                 FitWeightedCubic(Contrast,Strength,zBB,NP.fitBB,mBB);
00505 
00506                 /*td(zAA);
00507                 td(mAA);
00508                 td(zAB);
00509                 td(mAB);
00510                 td(zBB);
00511                 td(mBB);*/
00512 
00513                 sigma[0] = WeightedSigma(Contrast,mBB,zBB);
00514                 sigma[1] = WeightedSigma(Contrast,mAB,zAB);
00515                 sigma[2] = WeightedSigma(Contrast,mAA,zAA);
00516                 MinSigma(sigma, .001);
00517                 Compute_Weights(wAA,mAA,sigma[2],Contrast);
00518                 Compute_Weights(wAB,mAB,sigma[1],Contrast);
00519                 Compute_Weights(wBB,mBB,sigma[0],Contrast);
00520                 HardShell(Contrast,wAA,wBB);
00521                 /*td(wAA);
00522                 td(wAB);
00523                 td(wBB);
00524                 cout << "sigma\t";
00525                 td(sigma);*/
00526 
00527         }
00528         /*cout << "Fitted values" << endl;
00529         unsigned int dummy;
00530         for (dummy=0; dummy<Contrast.size(); dummy++)
00531         {
00532                 cout << dummy << "\t";
00533                 cout << Contrast[dummy] << "\t";
00534                 cout << Strength[dummy] << "\t";
00535                 cout << mAA[dummy] << "\t";
00536                 cout << mAB[dummy] << "\t";
00537                 cout << mBB[dummy] << "\t";
00538                 cout << zAA[dummy] << "\t";
00539                 cout << zAB[dummy] << "\t";
00540                 cout << zBB[dummy] << "\t";
00541                 cout << endl;
00542         }*/
00543         //td(Contrast);
00544         //td(mAA);
00545         //td(mAB);
00546         //td(mBB);
00547         // transfer useful data out of program
00548         // need: predictor vectors fAA, fAB, fBB
00549         // need: sigma
00550         NP.sigma.resize(3);
00551         NP.sigma[0]=sigma[0];
00552         NP.sigma[1]=sigma[1];
00553         NP.sigma[2]=sigma[2];
00554 }
00555 
00556 /*
00557  * Make covariates
00558  *
00559  * @param cov - covariate listing
00560  * @param Strength - the one initial covariate
00561  */
00562 void NormalizationPredictor::MakeCov(std::vector<double> &cov,const double Strength)
00563 {
00564         // refactor later to include vector<double> othervariables
00565         // also strength-target offset
00566         cov.resize(4);
00567         cov[0] = 1;
00568         cov[1] = Strength*cov[0];
00569         cov[2] = Strength*cov[1];
00570         cov[3] = Strength*cov[2];
00571 }
00572 
00573 /*
00574  * Make a prediction, given the covariate for a snp
00575  *
00576  * @param Contrast - input contrast
00577  * @param cov - covariates
00578  * @return new normalized contrast
00579  */
00580 double NormalizationPredictor::MakePrediction(const double Contrast,
00581                                               const std::vector<double> &cov)
00582 {
00583         // make a prediction given the covariate
00584         vector<double> predicted;
00585         double offset, AAd,ABd,BBd,sum;
00586 
00587         predicted.push_back(0);
00588         predicted.push_back(0);
00589         predicted.push_back(0);
00590         // get predicted center
00591         predicted[2] = vprod(cov,fitAA);
00592         predicted[1] = vprod(cov,fitAB);
00593         predicted[0] = vprod(cov,fitBB);
00594 
00595         // estimate odds of each genotype
00596         AAd = dnorm(Contrast,predicted[2],sigma[2]);
00597         ABd = dnorm(Contrast,predicted[1],sigma[1]);
00598         BBd = dnorm(Contrast,predicted[0],sigma[0]);
00599         if (Contrast>predicted[1])
00600                 BBd = 0;
00601         if (Contrast<predicted[1])
00602                 AAd = 0;
00603         sum = AAd+ABd+BBd;
00604         AAd /= sum;
00605         ABd /= sum;
00606         BBd /= sum;
00607 
00608         // weight needed offset by probability of each genotype
00609         offset = (TargetCenter[2]-predicted[2])*AAd;
00610         offset += (TargetCenter[1]-predicted[1])*ABd;
00611         offset += (TargetCenter[0]-predicted[0])*BBd;
00612         return(Contrast+offset); // estimated correction factor for contrast
00613 }
00614 
00615 /** copy off a previous set of functions */
00616 void NormalizationPredictor::Copy(NormalizationPredictor &Source)
00617 {
00618         fitAA.resize(Source.fitAA.size());
00619         fitAB.resize(Source.fitAB.size());
00620         fitBB.resize(Source.fitBB.size());
00621         sigma.resize(Source.sigma.size());
00622         CenterCovariates.resize(Source.CenterCovariates.size());
00623         TargetCenter.resize(Source.TargetCenter.size());
00624         copy(Source.fitAA.begin(),Source.fitAA.end(),fitAA.begin());
00625         copy(Source.fitAB.begin(),Source.fitAB.end(),fitAB.begin());
00626         copy(Source.fitBB.begin(),Source.fitBB.end(),fitBB.begin());
00627         copy(Source.sigma.begin(),Source.sigma.end(),sigma.begin());
00628         copy(Source.CenterCovariates.begin(),Source.CenterCovariates.end(),CenterCovariates.begin());
00629         copy(Source.TargetCenter.begin(),Source.TargetCenter.end(),TargetCenter.begin());
00630 }
00631 
00632 /** dump out some diagnostics */
00633 void NormalizationPredictor::Dump(std::ostream &out)
00634 {
00635         ctd(fitBB,out);
00636         ctd(fitAB,out);
00637         ctd(fitAA,out);
00638         ctd(sigma,out);
00639         ctd(CenterCovariates,out);
00640         ctd(TargetCenter,out);
00641         out << endl;
00642 }
00643 
00644 /** just the one covariate */
00645 void NormalizationFrame::FillInCovariates(const std::vector<double> &S)
00646 {
00647         Strength.resize(S.size());
00648         for (unsigned int i=0; i<S.size(); i++)
00649         {
00650                 Strength[i] = S[i];
00651         }
00652 }
00653 
00654 /** just the dependent variable */
00655 void NormalizationFrame::FillInContrast(const std::vector<double> &v) {
00656         Contrast.resize(v.size());
00657         for(unsigned int i = 0; i < v.size(); i++)
00658         {
00659                 Contrast[i] = v[i];
00660         }
00661 }
00662 
00663 /** wrapper for numeric function */
00664 void NormalizationFrame::FitEM() {
00665         EMContrast(Contrast,Strength,50, .05,ThisFit);
00666 }
